instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO: What is PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO? PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO is a power rail .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: i have this 33437 board , had slight water damage , cleaned , there was some trace missing around  smc i fixed those  those ; now board working but no audio, i also tried known good i/o board and flex cable , any idea where what would be wrong, in osx it showing no audio device , j9500 looks good too

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no audio
threads.message: <CHIP>U8040</CHIP> is a very common culprit when no audio devices are found. Do you get any voltage on <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0SW_AUDIO</SIGNAL>? If no, check for short on that line. I've had many 00164/5 boards have that chip be bad and cause no audio, so it wouldn't surprise me if that's the case here.
